details.name: description
details.old_value:
I have issues while using ET:L 2.72 that I never encounter in regular ET. While aiming it feels sluggish, it's very difficult to do well in the game because of this. I don't really have any technical data to support this, just my opinion of how it feels to play using the client. I have tried several times going back and forth and it feels like I can easily pull off 4:1 or 5:1 ratios in normal ET and in ET:L I end up with about 2:1. The aiming feels like something is holding me back from snapping and tracking the way I normally do.

I'm told ET:L uses raw input, maybe as a test it would be useful to have an option to switch back to windows input if that's even possible. I've tried using rinput and notice no change in normal ET in how the mouse movement feels. I have the MarkC mousefix applied in Windows 7.


h2. Here's some data about my configuration:

* i7-3770k (unparked cores)
* EVGA GTX780Ti ACX (NVIDIA 347.09 drivers)
* ASUS Xonar DG (UNi Xonar v1.75a rev.2 drivers)
* Coirsair K95
* Logitech g500s
* Windows 7 64-bit


h2. Process List:
!http://i.imgur.com/QGhWGhv.png()!
!http://i.imgur.com/ZJj9nFL.png()!

subject: Aiming latency problem
description:
I have issues while using ET:L 2.72 that I never encounter in regular ET. While aiming it feels sluggish, it's very difficult to do well in the game because of this. I don't really have any technical data to support this, just my opinion of how it feels to play using the client. I have tried several times going back and forth and it feels like I can easily pull off 4:1 or 5:1 ratios in normal ET and in ET:L I end up with about 2:1. The aiming feels like something is holding me back from snapping and tracking the way I normally do.

I'm told ET:L uses raw input, maybe as a test it would be useful to have an option to switch back to windows input if that's even possible. I've tried using rinput and notice no change in normal ET in how the mouse movement feels. I have the MarkC mousefix applied in Windows 7.
